phase1.name: Critical Fixes
phase1.description: Fix mobile UX bugs: eliminate horizontal scroll, improve readability

phase2.name: Engagement Enhancements
phase2.description: Add navigation aids for long-form content consumption

technicalNotes.responsiveTables: Use CSS Grid with grid-template-columns for desktop, stack vertically on mobile. Consider @container queries for future-proofing.
technicalNotes.progressBar: Prefer scroll event listener over CSS scroll-timeline due to Safari support (~85%). Throttle with requestAnimationFrame.
technicalNotes.toc: Use IntersectionObserver with rootMargin to detect current section. Store section refs in context or pass as props.
technicalNotes.typography: Tailwind prose plugin handles most defaults. Focus on prose size upgrade and heading balance.

postFeatureReview.summary: Implemented two-phase Mobile UX Optimization: Phase 1 fixed critical issues (responsive tables with card view, typography upgrade), Phase 2 added engagement features (reading progress bar, sticky mobile ToC)
postFeatureReview.impact: Article pages (guides, bettor-resources), UnifiedComparisonTable, ArticleGroups, GuideSections, ArticleHeader components
postFeatureReview.recommendations: Consider adding ToC to desktop as sidebar for very long articles; consider persisting ToC expanded/collapsed state
